# What is R?

[R is an Open Source and free programming language for statistical computing and graphics.]{.fragment style="color:#c97238;"}

# Why R?

## Non programmers point of view 

- It's Free

- The community &#x1F468;&#x200D;&#x1F4BB;

- Flexible and highly customizable outputs

- Created with Statistics at heart

- A higher learning curve than excel but better value

- Can integrate and read data from different systems, databases, systems like DHIS2, googlesheets, EPI-info, Stata, SPSS.


## Programmers point of view

- Easier to learn and understand compared to other languages for statistics purposes.

## Why do we need R when we have excel?

- Free and open source 

- One of the most popular tools for data analysis

- Can develop Web applications, dashboards, automatic reports, APIs, 

   **This Presentation was created using R** 

- Can easily integrate with other Languages Python, SQL, JavaScript, CSS

## RStudio cloud

RStudio Cloud is another product from [rstudio](rstudio.com) which gives you a lightweight, cloud-based version of RStudio Desktop IDE that allows you work with your r scripts, projects online and also share with your colleagues.
